metadata.name: Gcloud
metadata.description:
Google Cloud

Gcloud is the official library for interacting with the Google Cloud Platform. Google Cloud Platform is a set of modular cloud-based services that allow you to create anything from simple websites to complex applications.

Gcloud’s goal is to provide a API that is familiar and comfortable to Rubyists. Authentication is handled by providing project and credential information, or if you are running on Google Compute Engine this configuration is taken care of for you.

You can learn more about various options for connection on the Authentication Guide.

metadata.name: new
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to Google Cloud.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore
pubsub  = gcloud.pubsub
storage = gcloud.storage

params.name: project
params.description:
Project identifier for the Pub/Sub service you are
connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

metadata.name: datastore
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Datastore service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore

entity = dataset.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["description"] = "Get started with Google Cloud"
  t["completed"] = false
end

dataset.save entity

examples.caption: You shouldn’t need to override the default scope, but you can:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
dataset = gcloud.datastore scope: platform_scope

metadata.name: storage
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Storage service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage
bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
readonly_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.read_only"
readonly_storage = gcloud.storage scope: readonly_scope

metadata.name: pubsub
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Pub/Sub service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.publish "task completed"

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub scope: platform_scope

metadata.name: bigquery
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the BigQuery service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my-dataset"
table = dataset.table "my-table"
table.data.each do |row|
  puts row
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery scope: platform_scope

metadata.name: dns
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the DNS service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-zone"
zone.records.each do |record|
  puts record.name
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
readonly_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/ndev.clouddns.readonly"
dns = gcloud.dns scope: readonly_scope

metadata.name: resource_manager
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Resource Manager service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager
resource_manager.projects.each do |project|
  puts projects.project_id
end

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
readonly_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloudresourcemanager.readonly"
resource_manager = gcloud.resource_manager scope: readonly_scope

metadata.name: search
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Search service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code: require "gcloud"

metadata.name: logging
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Logging service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
logging = gcloud.logging
# ...

examples.caption: The default scope can be overridden with the scope option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud  = Gcloud.new
platform_scope = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-platform"
logging = gcloud.logging scope: platform_scope

metadata.name: dns
metadata.description: Creates a new Project instance connected to the DNS service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

dns = Gcloud.dns "my-dns-project",
                 "/path/to/keyfile.json"

zone = dns.zone "example-com"

params.name: project
params.description:
Identifier for a DNS project. If not present, the
default project for the credentials is used.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

metadata.name: storage
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Storage service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud/storage"

storage = Gcloud.storage "my-todo-project",
                         "/path/to/keyfile.json"

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"
file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

params.name: project
params.description:
Project identifier for the Storage service you are
connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

metadata.name: bigquery
metadata.description: Creates a new Project instance connected to the BigQuery service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

params.name: project
params.description:
Identifier for a BigQuery project. If not present,
the default project for the credentials is used.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

metadata.name: datastore
metadata.description: Creates a new object for connecting to the Datastore service. Each call creates a new connection.

examples.code:
require "gcloud/datastore"

dataset = Gcloud.datastore "my-todo-project",
                           "/path/to/keyfile.json"

entity = dataset.entity "Task" do |t|
  t["description"] = "Get started with Google Cloud"
  t["completed"] = false
end

dataset.save entity

params.name: project
params.description:
Dataset identifier for the Datastore you are
connecting to.

params.name: keyfile
params.description:
Keyfile downloaded from Google Cloud. If file
path the file must be readable.

examples.code:
